intro: Apatophyllum constablei, commonly known as the Constable's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, fleshy leaves and produces capsules as its fruit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
